operations.description: Deletes a secret. All versions are deleted.

operations.description: Restores a secret and all its versions from a backup file generated by Key Vault.

operations.description: List or view the properties of a secret, but not its value.

operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/certificatecas/read

operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/certificatecas/write

operations.description: Manage Certificate Contact
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/certificatecontacts/write

operations.description: Deletes a certificate. All versions are deleted.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/certificates/delete

operations.description: List certificates in a specified key vault, or get information about a certificate.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/certificates/read

operations.description: Creates the backup file of a certificate. The file can used to restore the certificate in a Key Vault of same subscription. Restrictions may apply.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/certificates/backup/action

operations.description: Purges a certificate, making it unrecoverable.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/certificates/purge/action

operations.description: Updates the specified attributes associated with the given certificate.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/certificates/update/action

operations.description: Creates a new certificate. If the certificate does not exist, the first version is created. Otherwise, a new version is created.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/certificates/create/action

operations.description: Imports an existing valid certificate containing a private key. The certificate to be imported can be in either PFX or PEM format. If the certificate does not exist in Key Vault, the first version is created with specified content. Otherwise, a new version is created with specified content.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/certificates/import/action

operations.description: Recovers the deleted certificate. The operation performs the reversal of the Delete operation. The operation is applicable in vaults enabled for soft-delete, and must be issued during the retention interval.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/certificates/recover/action

operations.description: Restores a certificate and all its versions from a backup file generated by Key Vault.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/certificates/restore/action

operations.description: List the keys in a specified vault, or read the current version of a specified key.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/read

operations.description: Creates the first version of a new key if it does not exist. If it already exists, then the existing key is returned without any modification. This API does not create subsequent versions, and does not update existing keys.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/write

operations.description: List keys in the specified vault, or read properties and public material of a key. For asymmetric keys, this operation exposes public key and includes ability to perform public key algorithms such as encrypt and verify signature. Private keys and symmetric keys are never exposed.
operations.displayName: Read Key Properties and Public Key
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/read

operations.description: Updates the specified attributes associated with the given key.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/update/action

operations.description: Creates a new key. If the key does not exist, the first version is created. Otherwise, a new version is created with the specified value.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/create/action

operations.description: Imports an externally created key. If the key does not exist, the first version is created with the imported material. Otherwise, a new version is created with the imported material.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/import/action

operations.description: Recovers the deleted key. The operation performs the reversal of the Delete operation. The operation is applicable in vaults enabled for soft-delete, and must be issued during the retention interval.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/recover/action

operations.description: Restores a key and all its versions from a backup file generated by Key Vault.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/restore/action

operations.description: Deletes a key. All versions are deleted.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/delete

operations.description: Creates the backup file of a key. The file can used to restore the key in a Key Vault of same subscription. Restrictions may apply.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/backup/action

operations.description: Purges a key, making it unrecoverable.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/purge/action

operations.description: Encrypts plaintext with a key. Note that if the key is asymmetric, this operation can be performed by principals with read access.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/encrypt/action

operations.description: Decrypts ciphertext with a key.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/decrypt/action

operations.description: Wraps a symmetric key with a Key Vault key. Note that if the Key Vault key is asymmetric, this operation can be performed by principals with read access.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/wrap/action

operations.description: Unwraps a symmetric key with a Key Vault key.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/unwrap/action

operations.description: Signs a message digest (hash) with a key.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/sign/action

operations.description: Verifies the signature of a message digest (hash) with a key. Note that if the key is asymmetric, this operation can be performed by principals with read access.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/verify/action

operations.description: Release a key using public part of KEK from attestation token.
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/release/action

operations.description: Creates a new version of an existing key (with the same parameters).
operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/keys/rotate/action

operations.name: Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/storageaccounts/read
